title: 112_s3190
content: The "Synthetic Drug Abuse Prevention Act of 2012" adds synthetic drugs to Schedule I of the Controlled Substances Act. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to include cannabimimetic agents in Schedule I, defining them as substances that act on cannabinoid receptors. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to include cannabimimetic agents in Schedule I, which are substances that act on cannabinoid receptors. Substances like alkyl or alkenyl substituted on the phenolic ring, 3-(1-naphthoyl)indole, 3-(1-naphthylmethane)indole, 3-(1-naphthoyl)pyrrole, and 1-(1-naphthylmethylene)indene are specified for substitution at specific positions on their respective rings. The Controlled Substances Act now includes cannabimimetic agents in Schedule I, such as 3-phenylacetylindole and 1-pentyl-3-(1-naphthoyl)indole, which are specified for substitution at specific positions on their respective rings. The Controlled Substances Act now includes various synthetic cannabinoids in Schedule I, such as JWH-018, JWH-073, JWH-019, JWH-200, JWH-250, JWH-081, JWH-122, JWH-398, AM2201, AM694, and other related compounds. The Controlled Substances Act now includes additional synthetic cannabinoids and other drugs in Schedule I, such as 1-pentyl-3-[(4-methoxy)-benzoyl]indole, 1-cyclohexylethyl-3-(2-methoxyphenylacetyl)indole, 1-pentyl-3-(2-chlorophenylacetyl)indole, 4-methylmethcathinone, 3,4-methylenedioxypyrovalerone, 2-(2,5-Dimethoxy-4-ethylphenyl)ethanamine, 2-(2,5-Dimethoxy-4-methylphenyl)ethanamine, 2-(4-Chloro-2,5-dimethoxyphenyl)ethanamine, 2-(4-Iodo-2,5-dimethoxyphenyl)ethanamine, and 2-[4-(Ethylthio)-2,5-dimethoxyphenyl]ethanamine. The Controlled Substances Act now includes additional synthetic cannabinoids and other drugs in Schedule I, such as 2C-T-2, 2C-T-4, 2C-H, 2C-N, and 2C-P. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to extend temporary scheduling to avoid imminent hazards to public safety by increasing the time period from one year to two years and from six months to one year.
